title: (x) "Freestyle Electronics" square tech sans - Dev Gothic {Dav}
content:
Hi, I need help identifying the font pictured in the attachment.  
I thought it might be by BD, but after checking trough their catalog it turned out to be from somewhere else. Please note that it says FR33S7YL3 3L3C7R0N.. and not for example FREE...  
thanks already!  
olli

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [unknownfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234227/http:/typophile.com/files/unknownfont_0.jpg) | 30.87 KB |

 [‹ (x) Diane & Anthony elegant script - Citadel Script {Sebastian}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234227/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18549 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Robben Island, Cape Town, South Africa - Basque {Mark C} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234227/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18598 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mursu909

comments.content:
Olli

It’s very similar to [Alpha Headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20080829234227/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Custom+Typefaces/Alpha+Headline) (which is exclusively licensed to Mitsubishi) but the leg of the “R” differs. The link says Alpha Headline was derived from the type used for English car registration plates and gives the name of the original designer. May be useful for tracking down an exact match?

“It’s very similar to Alpha Headline (which is exclusively licensed to Mitsubishi) but the leg of the “R” differs. The link says Alpha Headline was derived from the type used for English car registration plates and gives the name of the original designer. May be useful for tracking down an exact match?”

Any idea how they got that menu thing to float like that? Or is that some fancy Flash technique?
